studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Changed KCCQ score reporting from clinical/overall to total symptom score.
Addition of an Echocardiographic Sub-study including objectives and procedures.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 2.3, 6.3.1, 6.3.2.6 - Safety Objectives and AE Collection
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Expanded AE collection to include events preceding lower limb amputation.
Clarified exclusion criteria 3 and 13; extended contraceptive requirements for criterion 16.
Removed adjudication requirement for eGFR decline renal endpoints.
Limited event types withheld from health authority reporting to HF and fatal AEs only.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Discussion with regulatory authorities regarding lower limb amputation risks.
Feedback from regulatory authorities and harmonization with the Informed Consent Form (ICF).
Endpoint criteria did not justify the adjudication of eGFR decline events.
Simplify SAE reporting and minimize risk of incorrectly withholding renal AEs of interest.
Correcting typos, cross-references, and alignment with AstraZeneca House style.

studyChanges.summary: Updated the specific KCCQ score used for secondary variable analysis.
Added a new section to capture information related to the echocardiographic sub-study.

studyChanges.afterText: AEs leading to amputation and AEs leading to a risk for lower limb amputations (preceding events)
studyChanges.summary: Expanded safety reporting to include events that place a patient at risk for amputation.

studyChanges.beforeText: Requirement of adjudicating potential endpoints related to eGFR decline
studyChanges.summary: Eliminated the need for adjudication for specific renal decline endpoints.

studyChanges.afterText: Investigator responsibility regarding standard of care treatment after IP discontinuation
studyChanges.summary: Clarified post-IP treatment responsibilities for investigators.
